ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix 3.1.0-RC1 release now available
ygData.msgSnippet: I ran our latest .is domain crawl using 3.1-RC1 and can say that it is definitely an improvement on 3.0 in terms of stability. I found no regressions, except

I ran our latest .is domain crawl using 3.1-RC1 and can say that it is defi=
nitely an improvement on 3.0 in terms of stability. 

I found no regression=
s, except that there doesn't seem to be a sample profile included anymore. =
Given that profiles from 3.0 need to be updated in several areas, this is a=
n issue.

I did find a sample profile in the source code, but even that is =
(somewhat) incorrect as it still shows "holdQueues" to be a valid setting f=
or BdbFrontier (is present but commented out, implying that you can uncomme=
nt if you want non-default behavior). This setting has however been removed=
 (perhaps moved elsewhere?).

Other, commented out, features should probabl=
y be reviewed to ensure they are still valid.

- Kristinn

--- In archive-c=
rawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
